Jining is a prefecture-level city in southwestern Shandong province.  The city has around 200,000 inhabitants and the prefecturate around 8 million.  The city is located right to the north of Nanyang  Lake (南阳湖; Nányáng Hú) and is today the northernmost city reachable by navigation on the
There is an airport in Jining 28km from the city centre and with quite few flights.

to Jining with a travel duration of 2½-3 hours and costs of ¥14-45.  There are two trains each day from
with a travel duration of around 8 hours and costs of ¥41-120.  Also trains from major cities like
There are the usual western fast food restaurants.

- the birthplace of Confucius with temples and museums honoring him.  Buses from 06.40AM to 6.00PM at 20 minute intervals at the Jining North Coach Bus Station. The bus station can be reached by the city-bus No.4, 26, 30, 31, 36 and 102.
- the birthplace of Mencius, who was the most important interpreter of Confucius' thoughts.  The Temple of Mencius and the Mencius Family Mansion are both here.
- a mountain resort 10 kilometers south of the Zoucheng with spectacular natural sceneries and historical relics, especially featuring the granite pebbly landscape.
